title: Academic Discipline / Field / Theory Frame
description: JSON schema for academic discipline / field / theory frames (`discipline-theory`).

frame_type.description: Canonical frame family identifier for this frame.

main_entity.description: The discipline / field / theory itself (canonical label, IDs, etc.).

discipline_kind.description: Coarse kind of discipline or theory, e.g. "academic_discipline", "scientific_field", "theory".

parent_disciplines.description: List of broader disciplines / fields that this discipline or theory is considered a part of.

subdisciplines.description: List of subdisciplines / subfields / specializations commonly treated as parts of this discipline.

origin_timespan.description: Approximate period when the discipline or theory emerged as a distinct concept or field.

origin_region_lemmas.description: Neutral lemmas describing the main cultural / geographic regions associated with the origin (e.g. ["europe"], ["ancient_greece"], ["united_states"]).

key_figures.description: Prominent people associated with the discipline or theory (e.g. "Albert Einstein", "Noam Chomsky").

core_concept_lemmas.description: Lemmas naming central concepts, constructs, or topics of the field (e.g. ["manifold"], ["continuous_function"], ["metric_space"], ["attention"], ["memory"], ["perception"]).

applications_lemmas.description: Lemmas describing major application areas of the discipline / theory (e.g. ["engineering"], ["medicine"], ["artificial_intelligence"], ["economics"]).

schools_traditions_lemmas.description: Lemmas naming major internal schools, traditions, or approaches (e.g. ["behaviorism"], ["structuralism"], ["functionalism"]).

influenced_disciplines.description: List of disciplines / fields that this discipline or theory has significantly influenced.

influenced_by.description: List of disciplines / theories / schools that influenced the emergence or development of this discipline or theory.

attributes.description: Additional, structured properties that do not justify their own fields (e.g. domain classification, typical degree levels, classification codes).

extra.description: Arbitrary metadata, typically used for provenance or storing the original source representation. Not interpreted by the core semantics layer.

Entity.description: Minimal entity representation used in discipline / theory frames.

id.description: Source-specific identifier for the entity (e.g. Wikidata QID, internal ID).

TimeSpan.description: Loose representation of a time span or single date.

approximate.description: Whether the date / span is approximate.

extra.description: Free-form metadata (e.g. original string, calendar system).
